com.ikalagaming.util

Class NameRegistry

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.util.NameRegistry

  • public class NameRegistry
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains a list of Strings. Each string has a list of integers that represent ID numbers for that string, all of which are unique. These numbers start at zero and increase. When names are unregistered (that is, an index value is now no longer in use), it becomes available again for other matching strings to use. The smallest unused integer will always be used next.

    This allows for sets of objects which require unique names, such as Entities in a game or UI elements that may be created at runtime but need to be referenced by their unique identifier.

    Author:
    Ches Burks

      • contains

        public boolean contains(java.lang.String fullName)
        Returns true if the base name exists in the registry and has the given ID registered to itself. If the name is
        Parameters:
        fullName - the entire name of the object, including base name, dash, and ID
        Returns:
        true if that name and ID pair exists, otherwise false

      • getNextID

        public int getNextID(java.lang.String baseName)
        Returns the ID that will next be registered for a base name. This will be 0 of that name has never been registered. Otherwise it will be the number as defined by IntegerTree.getSmallestUnusedInt().

        Note: This is not guaranteed to be the next ID. It is possible this ID might not match the one created when registering in some cases, such as another object with the same name being registered between the method calls.

        Parameters:
        baseName - the string that IDs are registered for
        Returns:
        the next ID that will be registered for the given name

      • registerName

        public java.lang.String registerName(java.lang.String baseName)
        Registers a name in the registry. The base name is the string that name collisions are checked against. The function registers the next available name that can be created using the base name, then returns the newly created name. The generated name is the base name, followed immediately by a single dash ('-'), followed immediately by a unique integer ID for that base name.

        For example, "House" might be the name to register. The first time house is registered, "House-0" is registered/returned. The next time register is called for "House", while "House-0" has not been unregisterd, "House-1" will be returned. Say "House-0" were now unregistered, but "House-1" remained. The next call using "House" as the base name will register "House-0" instead of "House-3", because 0 is now free. If register is then called using "Car", "Car-0" will be returned as all strings use their own pool of ID's.

        Parameters:
        baseName - The base string to create and register an ID for
        Returns:
        the newly created unique name for the object

      • unregisterName

        public boolean unregisterName(java.lang.String fullName)
        Unregisters a name from the registry. The name should follow the format that matches what is created by registerName(String) . For reference that is a string that is formed as follows: Base name (String)+'-'+ID (Integer). If the name is not registered, or has an invalid format for any reason, returns false. Returns true if the name was unregistered correctly.
        Parameters:
        fullName - the entire name of the object, including base name, dash, and ID
        Returns:
        true if the name was unregistered, otherwise false
